div1.p: Carter informs his aunt that Leake and Hench are searching for information about Henry Rose Carter. He encloses the letter from Leake.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter, Jr., to Mary Clayborne Carter, January 1, 1947
div1.p: This letter is written to wish you and the family a happy New Year!

We certianly hope that all with be well and happiness will be
yours to receive as well as give for the later is and will always be something
that we can be sure of having!

Tell Carter that Col Melson Bwarfield *Carter gave a new year
party last evening and all who were present wearly fell m in love with the
ham he sent us.

I am sending you a letter from Dr. James P Leake relative to
his request to obtain data for Dr. Hench who wants to write a biography
of Dr. Walter Reed. The book relative to Dr, Carlos Finlay's contributions
has already been seen to him, he also wanted a copy of father's paper on
extrinsic incubation published 1900 New Orleans Medical & Surgical Journal
May 1900. As you will see from his letter Dr. Leake is having photographs
made of the litierture sent to him which he is going to sent DRr, Hench!

As I remember Laura left all of this data in Ashland and if
it is possible sent the data to Dr. Leake as Dr. Hench wishes to get sll
the credit given to father's name that is possible. I looked over all the
papers we have here and the one we wanted was not here. If you can find
father's paper send it to Dr, James P. Leake Medical Director (Retired)
U.S. Public Health Service.
U.S. Public Health Service
National Institute of Health
Bethseda, 14, Maryland.

closer.salute:
With love from Melson and me to you Jennie, Carter and the family
Always affectionately your's
